p: The powder of C. europaea (30 g) was macerated with 100 ml of methanol (MeOH) for 72 h at room temperature. The mixture was filtered and concentrated at 60°C. The obtained residue was dissolved in distilled water and then extracted again successively three times with 3 × 30 ml (chloroform, diethyl ether, n-hexane, ethyl acetate, and n-butanol) to get respective extracts. The flavonoids contained in the last phase were recovered and then subjected to evaporation at 55°C in order to obtain the dry residue [ 21].
